trans-unit.source: Represents a perspective projection camera.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera> specifies a projection of a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)] model to a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] visual surface.
This projection includes perspective foreshortening.
In other words, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera> describes a frustrum whose sides converge toward a point on the horizon.
Objects closer to the camera appear larger, and objects farther from the camera appear smaller.
The following diagram shows the difference between orthographic and perspective-foreshortened camera projections.
![Orthographic and perspective projection](~/add/media/camera-projections4.png "Orthographic and perspective projection")
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera"></xref> class using the specified position, direction, and field of view.
Point3D that specifies the camera's position.
Vector3D that specifies the direction of the camera's projection.
Vector3D that specifies the upward direction according to the perspective of the onlooker.
Width of the camera's angle of projection, specified in degrees.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets a value that represents the camera's horizontal field of view.
For <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera>, "field of view" is the horizontal bounds of the camera's projection between the camera's position and the image plane.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier Field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The camera's horizontal field of view, in degrees.
The default value is 45.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PerspectiveCamera.FieldOfView"></xref> dependency property.
